metadata.title: CVE-2019-17533 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Mat_VarReadNextInfo4 in mat4.c in MATIO 1.5.17 omits a certain '\0'character, leading to a heap-based buffer over-read in strdup_vprintf whenuninitialized memory is accessed.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-17533` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmatio2 - 1.5.2-1ubuntu1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libmatio package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.5.2-1ubuntu1+esm1').
libpdl-io-matlab-perl: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
mldemos: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
